clean_data: Technical Lead Technical Lead Technical Lead PepsiCo Plano TX Over 15 Years of IT experience in analysis design and implementation and testing of various ClientServer Applications Web Based Applications using Java J2EE Technologies Object oriented programming Concepts and Database administration Extensively worked with Ecommerce and Banking domain with good knowledge of developing complex projects and good management skills of the deliverables Have excellent exposure to all stages of Software development Life Cycle and proficient with CMMi level processes Experience in ant maven Jenkins and Bit bucket Experience in Cybersource Elavon Smartclicx and OneSource Knowledge on Channel Advisor process Knowledge on Endeca Search tool and Oracle Workbench Experienced in Core Java Struts and Spring Frame Work Proficient in J2EE components such as Servlets JDBC Java Beans struts and Hibernate Experience in writing database objects like Stored Procedures Functions and PLSQL packages for Oracle SQL Server and MySQL Expertise in developing the custom XMLJSON parsers and message services and queuing systems using Jaxb Jettison JMS and IBM MQ Extensive experience in UNIX LINUX and Windows ProjectProgram Management work involving Point of Sale Integrations Compliance Supply Chain and Retail Experienced in Elastic Path Core Java 17 JavaJ2EESpring MVC REST Web services AWS Cloud Spring Boot DB2 Maven Git Bit Bucket Jenkins and UNIX shell scripts Experienced in Agile Framework and SAFE frame work Experienced in Rest and Soap frameworks Experienced AWS tools EC2boxes Lambda Dynamo Db Code deploy and Step functions Experienced in Micro Services Ability and desire to learn new tools and technologies Experience with Ajax XML XSLT a plus Experienced in ecommerce Domain worked for Kohls Belkcom Trimblecom and PepsiCo clients Experienced in eCommerce Frameworks 1 Blue Martini 2 Elastic PathEP 3 Spring Frame work 4 Sprint Boot Spring Batch 5 SAFE Sponsorship required to work in the US Work Experience Technical Lead PepsiCo Plano TX January 2019 to Present Description The scope of eCommerce Channel advisor integration Power of Program project is to automate and integrate orders from eCommerce third party market place 3PL eRetailers Consumers Amazon eBay etc from Channel Advisor to PepsiCo SAP ECC system Integration will include completedNonlive as well as Live orders flowing from channel advisor Ability to interface live and nonlive order from channel advisor or eCommerce HUB Ability to make order changes as well as cancellations for live orders once created in SAP Once customer placed an order in different marketing sites those orders are called as Live Orders and all orders are routed to SAP through Power of One project Once SAP receives the Live orders fulfill those orders and posted to CA using power of program Like Shipment Notifications all inventory are also posting using power of project As part of this project we are implementing the split order future based on Order type in order response from Channel Advisor As a Tech lead I am responsible for 1 Implement the Integration with Channel AdvisorCA 2 Implement Integration with SAP and XI 3 Experienced in Cloud Foundry PCF 4 Implementation of CICD Pipeline Using Concourse 5 Involved in Fortify scan integration 6 Experienced in PCF and Azure 7 Assist the team members in the Technical domain related queries 8 Involved in Peer testing and end to end execution of project 9 Work on Enhancement as result the for production fix 10 Involved in postproduction deployment and support in case of production issues 11 Develop the microservices to perform variety of services Ex Order Inventory Product Split Order 12 Integration with ElkKibana for logging 13 Experienced in Power BI for Reporting 14 Implemented services using node js Environment Spring Batch Spring boot Node js Cloud Foundry PCF CICD Pipeline implementation Azure Fortify Scan SonarQubeVSTS Bit bucket GIT Elk Kibana Kafka MSSQL Couch DB Microservices Couch base Agile XML and SOAP and SAFE Technical Lead Trimble Navigation December 2016 to January 2019 Description Trimble is a leading provider of advanced locationbased solutions that maximize productivity and enhance profitability The Company integrates its positioning expertise in GPS laser optical and inertial technologies with application software wireless communications and services to provide complete commercial solutions Trimble serves a variety of industries including agriculture engineering and construction transportation and wireless communications infrastructure The Companys portfolio of over 1200 patents is the basis for the broadest positioning solutions portfolio in the industry We started working on preparing the B2B platform for selling subscriptions and managing licenses using Elastic Path frame work As a Tech leadIT Project manager I am responsible for 1 Own the Responsibility of the overall sprint or iteration outcome 2 Use projects best practices and coding standards 3 Prepare and help team to prepare the design should have a very good understanding of the project architecture 4 Coding and unit testing including JUnits 5 Conduct peer review and provide feedback 6 Remove the technical impediments 7 Update regular associates RAG Red Amber Green status discuss the Red cases on the immediate basis with the project manager to help the manager in the attrition management 8 Interface between team and management 9 Write quality code set an example of quality in front of the team members 10 Provide the road maps to team and make sure the delivery 11 Proactive implementation of Dev ops 12 Assist the team members in the Technical domain related queries 13 Involved in Peer testing and end to end execution of project 14 Work on Enhancement as result the for production fix 15 We have used Micro services to implement the separate services like Account Service EMS Entitlement Management system and FCH Fusion Commerce Hub applications 16 We have used the Micro services to implement the Separate testing tool using spring boot application 17 Report the status with alarms explanations and solutions Promptly escalate issues to the reporting manager Track and resolve issues Environment Elastic Path Frame Work Micro Services REST APIs AWS Cloud EC2boxes Lambda Dynamo Db Code deploy and Step functions ARIA billing Engine Cyber Source vertex and Safenet applications XML Oracle Splunk and Sumo Logic Technical Lead BELK Charlotte March 2010 to December 2016 Date Description Belk Inc a private department store company based in Charlotte NC is the home of Modern Southern Style with 293 Belk stores located in 16 Southern states and a growing digital presence Belk is a portfolio company of Sycamore Partners a private equity firm based in New York Belk and wwwbelkcom offer a wide assortment of national brands and private label fashion apparel shoes and accessories for the entire family along with top name cosmetics a wedding registry and a large selection of quality merchandise for the home Belk offers many ways to connect via digital and social media including Facebook Pinterest Twitter Instagram YouTube and Google Plus and provides exclusive offers fashion updates sales notifications and coupons via email or mobile phone text messages Customers can also download the latest Belk mobile apps for the iPad iPhone or Android As a Tech Lead I am responsible for Performed complete application life cycle functions SDLC from conception to final release to users including design analysis Implementation Testing Deployment and Maintenance Prepared the LLD using Microsoft Visio to record the requirements as is and cover the assumptions that we have with the upstream and downstream to be in agreement Interacted with business analysts and end users in gathering requirements Prepared technical artifacts including UML Class diagrams Sequence diagrams etc using MS Visio Developed and implemented the MVC Architectural Pattern using Spring MVC and Blue Martini Framework Development of UIs with the help of Struts UI Tags Reviewed the modules developed by offshore team to make sure code is reflecting the LLD and code standardsbest practices are followed Monitored the production logs in Splunkintroscope during the warranty period and took care of fixing the high severity issues in the expected SLA Managed E Commerce projects by building storefront solutions and setting up payment gateway Created and maintained customer service training program for 20 offshore contact center agents to deliver a unified global customer support experience Provide the road maps to team and make sure the delivery Proactive implementation of Dev ops Environment Core Java JavaJ2EESpring MVC Blue Martini Micro Services REST APIs JaxRS Web services JAXWS Spring frameworkDB2Sybase IBM MQ Splunk JMS MS Visio Introscope AzulGomezDynatrace IBM Websphere Putty SSH Techia MavenGit Bit Bucket Jenkins and UNIX shell scripts Sr Java Lead Kohls March 2008 to January 2010 Description Kohls Corporation is an American departmental store offers a wide range of products through Departmental Stores Online Call centers and through EMails Goal is to provide customers with a streamlined efficient and world class personalized shopping experience which will be supported with the bestofbreed technology platform As a Tech Lead I am responsible for Performed complete application life cycle functions SDLC from conception to final release to users including design analysis Implementation Testing Deployment and Maintenance Prepared the LLD using Microsoft Visio to record the requirements as is and cover the assumptions that we have with the upstream and downstream to be in agreement Interacted with business analysts and end users in gathering requirements Prepared technical artifacts including UML Class diagrams Sequence diagrams etc using MS Visio Monitored the production logs in Splunkintroscope during the warranty period and took care of fixing the high severity issues in the expected SLA Involved in writing and reviewing Unit Test using JUNIT and Mockito We have used Micro services to implement the review rating application Environment Core Java JavaJ2EESpring MVC Blue Martini JaxRS Web services JAXWS Spring frameworkDB2Sybase IBM MQ Splunk JMS MS Visio Introscope AzulGomezDynatrace IBM Websphere Putty SSH Techia MavenGit Bit Bucket Jenkins and UNIX shell scripts Java Lead SRAS March 2006 to January 2008 Client SUN Description Risk Analysis is a methodology comprised of tools technologies quantitative indices and business processes used to identify and prioritize all components of risk in a customer data center With the Risk Analysis methodology we can identify assess quantify and recommend mitigation for data center risks faced by our customers and field services employees As a Lead I am responsible for Involved in Requirement Analysis Design Develop and Implement the application using J2EE technology Translated business requirements into detailed design Developed xml schemas and WSDL documents by understanding the business requirements Participate in Code Analysis and Test Plan Reviews Involved in preparing test cases for System Testing and User Acceptance Testing Actively involved in production support fixing the problem and provide appropriate documentation describing the root cause of the problem actions taken to rectify etc Involved in fixing the SIT and UAT issues Java Developer SHINSEI BANK JP August 2004 to February 2006 Environment Core Java JSP SERVLET and EJB Description Orbi Invest provides Branch and Internet platform for High Net Worth HNW Retail customers of Shinsei Bank with the StandIn acting as the baseIt is an integrated portfolio management system managing retail Investments in mutual funds equities bonds and warrants As a Developer I am responsible for Involved in analysis Design Coding and Testing in the following modules 1 Account Operations 2 Making The Subscription Buy Redemption Sell Orders 3 Authorizing the Orders 4 Responsible for all the Deployment and code drops in different environments Purchase Officer Purchase Approval CostCenter Management and Catalog Management February 2003 to August 2004 Project name OilPalmWorldOPW Malaysia 2003 Feb to 2004 August Description The OilPalmWorld OPW project builds an independent eProcurement product that can automate the traditional business procurement processes The present phase is intended to develop the core engine of eprocurement The scope includes the following modules Requisitioning Requisition Approvals Creation Of Preferred List Creation Of Requisition Basket Purchase Officer Purchase Approval CostCenter Management and Catalog Management As a Team member I am responsible for 1 Preparing the Preferred list with selected items Creating the requisition Basket with selected items from preferred list Making the requisition from requisition basket Creating the items those are supplied by each supplier Creating the Preferred Catalog and open Catalog Items Implemented ModelViewController MVC Architected Education Masters
